Colophon: Expliciunt…lesquels furent escrips en le ville de Maigny es armentieres au commendement de noble et redoubte seigneur mons. Visual_Analysis_Other: Written at the end of the manuscript in the same script as the main text. The text of the colophon is underlined and separated as its own paragraph.

Type: Medical works of Guy de Chauliac
Colophon: Explicit. A. Dieu. Noel.

Colophon: Sequitur tabula istius libri incepta per me Anthonium Suliniacii, vicarium loci of Candilhanica. - Anno Domini milleimo IIII c LXVIII ° et die sancte Leucadie, mense decembri, fuit scripta presens tabula per me Anthonium Soliniaci.
Visual_Analysis_Other: Written on the first page of the manuscript above a table in the same script as the main text.

Colophon: Presens huic hoperi sit gracia neumpmatis almi Me iuvet et faciat complere quod utile fiat…a.d. 1441 die 4 mensis iulii presens…fuit incepta per me bartholomeum audiberti ad honorem dei et b. marie eius matris ac predicti sancti tociusque celestis curie completum anno. Ab isto principio laudetur maria virgo. f. 12r. Finito libro sit laus et gloria xpisto. a. incarnationis d. 1442 et die 5 mensis decembris vig. beatiss. nicholay confess. ecclesie turonensis ac tocius cleri advocatoris Romansium predictum vite b. et illustriss. honorati arelaten. epi et 500 martirum qui in Insula Lirinensi passi sunt Ad eorum laudem et honorem Ego bartholomeus audeberti cappellanus de areis tholonensis dyocesis manu mea propria scripsi et id scribendo complevi in civitate foroiulii me existente clavario dni mei foroiulien. in J(acobi Iuvenalis de Ursinis) miser. divina episcopi De cuius opere suppliciter laudes reddo debitas ut teneor altissimo creatori ac beatiss. virgini marie et toti celesti curie. Visual_Analysis_Other: Colophons written in the same script as the main text.

Colophon: Saphico versu libet intimare / Cuius hic factus [scriptus] liber est labore / Quisque sollempni teneatur usu compotus anni / Mille sunt anni deciesque deni / Bis quater denos quibusque bis unum / Addicis, lector, fuit ortus ex quo Christus in orbe / Hac in annorum serie propinqua / Fovit Altus Mons iuvenem cluentem / Flore malarum, Iacobum vocatum, scribere doctum / Inde servivit studio frequenti / Cui Petrus celi reserando portas / Letus occurrens proprio probatum iungat ovili. Amen.
Visual_Analysis_Other: In the bottom of the right column of text. Same script as main text. At the end of the manuscript. Followed by another inscription in a different hand from 1619.

Colophon: Regimberto abbati, Ravangero quoque et Ereboni scriptoribus requies eterna donetur. Amen. Si quis abstulerit, anathema sit. Amen.

Type: Fragments of documents found mostly in binders about history, science, and letters.
Colophon: Leuthtardus christi famulus supraemus Iesu Codicis hoc manibus nuper opus istius egit. Scripsit enim propriis illud calamoque verenter Auctor adest Paulus cuius hec dicta tenentur. Visual_Analysis_Other: Written at the bottom of the last page of main text. Spaced well below main text. Written in same hand as main text.

Type: Lives of saints and other religious texts
Colophon: Hic liber est scriptus clarus studioque legentis. Gestis pontificum iam quinque duorum Sedis Tungrensis Traiecti Leodiensis. Domno Annoni venerabili coloniensium archipresuli presbiterorum imfimus.

Colophon: Adalardo
Visual_Analysis_Other: Written near the beginning of the manuscript. The letters "ADA" are written very large at the bottom of the right column of text. The letters "LAR" are written between the stems of the first "A" of "ADA." The letter "D" is written inside of the "D" of "ADA," and below a floral decoration also within the "D" of "ADA." An "O" is written between the "D" and the final "A" of "ADA." The script is a capitalized version of the script in which the main text is written.

Colophon: Açenarius scripsit librum istum. Et deus benedicat eum. Amen. Amen. Amen.
Visual_Analysis_Other: Written near the end of the manuscript, at the bottom of the page in the same script as the main text. The first "Amen" is written spaced out, extending over most of the line.

Colophon: Hunc ego Gundoinus Germane tibi offero librum.
Visual_Analysis_Other: In the top margin on the first page. In slightly different, capitalized script than main text.

Colophon: Explicit…Quem collecta iuvant collectoris memor esto Ut sibi post mortem Xpi sit gratia presto Hunc librum scripsit f. Enniorrannus a. d. 1276.
Visual_Analysis_Other: On the last page of the manuscript written in a fainter ink than that of the main text, but in the same script. Colophon spans from the bottom of the left column of text to the top of the right column of text.

Colophon: Haimus monachus. Hoc volumen histori in libris viii. Arum Alexandri Magni. domno Chuinrado illustrissimo comiti dedit. Ut ipse accomodare ei dignetur expositionem Hrabani in librum ecclesiasticum ad transcribendum cuius exordium est. Omnis sapientia a dno deo est.
Visual_Analysis_Other: Written on the first page of the manuscript in a capitalized version of the same script as the main text.

Colophon: Xps Ragnardum salvet, tueatur, honoret, Pro nobis qui quondam proditus immo benignus Argenti parvo cecatus munere Iudas. Et cruce iam positus post hec surrexit in altum, Sessurus celum qui nunc cuncta gubernat olimpo. f. 87r. Ter ternos habuit annos qui scripserat istut. Obsequium fidei iuvenis Hieronimus infans, Nobilis antiqua procerum de stirpe procreatus, Filius hic genitus fulgens ab origine Karli Et genuit fortis regnator Pippinus illum, Filius Helvidi Ragnardus conferat ista. Quem genuit miles Ragnerus fulgidus ymmo. f. 186r.
Visual_Analysis_Other: Colophon on 87r in same script as main text about two-fifths of the way through the manuscript. Separated from main text by space and a large "Bestiarum explicit" denoting the end of the previous section. Following text is in a lighter hand. Colophon on 186r is in the same script as main text as well. It is separated from the main text with a space and the "T" of "Ter" is capitalized much larger than the other capitalized letters of the page. It is very near the end of the manuscript, though there are about twenty more openings

Colophon: a. ab incarnatione dni n.i.x. 1114 explicatum est hoc librum Aimerici presbiter a W. scriptore Landevetule. Erat autem indictio VI concurrens tertius epacta pridie nonas iulii dnica advesperascente Lune vero 11 temporibus pascalis pape urbis rome, o sancte Michael archangele xpi miserere Guillelmo scriptori scribenti librum tuum
Visual_Analysis_Other: Written in greek letters at the end of the manuscript. Colophon comprises the entire page, separate from main text.

Colophon: Completus est presens liber in alma universitate Parisius scriptus per me Franciscum Fine sub ven. ac prospicuo viro M. Johanne Hannon sacre sancte theologie tunc bacalario famosissimo a. d. 1472 et die penultima sept. que fuit dies s Michaelis archangeli ... Amen. F. Fine.
Visual_Analysis_Other: Continuous with main script, written in the same hand. Text is split into two columns throughout text, colophon is in the column on the right.

Colophon: ΔΣ ΑΔΗΣΘΩ ΣΚΡΙΒΗΝΘΗ ΑΔΑΛΒΑΛΔΩ. f. 6r. Vos qui estis lecturi orate pro scriptore ΣΙ ΔΜ ΑΒΗΑΘΙΣ ΠΡΩΘΗΚΘΩΡΗΜ. f. 65v.

Colophon: Domn. Addas Godefridus obtulit hunc librum s. Willibrordo suisque ibi Deo servientibus. f. 2. Gerardus scriptor eat in celum. raptor in infernum. f. 110
Visual_Analysis_Other: Colophon on f. 2 takes up entire page with large and widely-spaced letters. Colophon on f. 110 is about halfway through the codex and looks similar to the previous colophon, though it is split into two columns, and there is some main text above the beginning of the colophon.

Colophon: Hic est liber S. Maximini Miciacensis monasterii quem Petrus abbas scribere iussit.
Visual_Analysis_Other: Written in capitalized and doubly spaced script in a paragraph below main text in the middle of the manuscript.

Colophon: Domn. abb. Regimbertus, divinarum scripturarum auctor precipuus, hunc canonum librum fieri instituit. Si quis abstulerit, anathema sit. Amen.
Visual_Analysis_Other: Written in the left margin on one of the first pages of the manuscript. Generously spaced such that text extends down entire page. In same script as main text.

Colophon: Adam sydereum mereatur scandere regnum.
Visual_Analysis_Other: Written in large capital letters spanning from the bottom margin of 47v to the bottom margin of 48r. Near the middle of the manuscript.

Colophon: Explicit…per me Domnum Andream de Rachelis de Parma. In Vincentia. Millo. MLXXVIII. Indic. die lune 11 madii. Deo gratias. Amen. Laus tibi Christe.
Visual_Analysis_Other: Written about halfway down the last page of the manuscript, in the same script as the main text.

Colophon: hoc opus exegi sit summo gloria regi Gloria sit illi finem ponendo labori Circa natale quod est tempus hiemale, Anno milleno tricentissimo nonogeno. Sit celo locatus author cirencestria natur pro ipso cari pluries curate preccari. Mensse Maii per Fretwell 1594 ex libro autentico authoris many scripto 1390. membrana.
Visual_Analysis_Other: The only text I saw was "Mensse Maii per Fretwell 1594 ex libro autentico authoris many scripto 1390. membrana." at the end of the text in the same hand as the main script. Slightly separated from main text.

Colophon: Qui finise el libro dito Cesariano chonpilato e trato da salustio e da luchano e da molti altri sapientissimi autori e chonpilatori de li fati de romani de cesaro et de ponpeio e de chatalina e molti altri. schrito per mi franescho de meser guido dalachorna strapazadamente [ç above z] a di .xi. de nouenbro de 1464. Deo gracias amen.
Visual_Analysis_Other: In same script as main text. The words "Qui finise el libro dito Cesariano" are capitalized, while the "Q" is in red ink. At the bottom of the left column of text, about three quarters of the way through the manuscript at the end of the life of Ceasar and preceding a poem about Caesar's death and a story about Thebes.

Colophon: Dic quicumque legis preclari gesta patroni Pauperis Albini xpiste memento tui.
Visual_Analysis_Other: Written near the beginning of the manuscript, in the same script as the main text, and contiguous with the main text.
